tool.name: MIRA v4.0 miraconvert
tool.command: mira4_convert.py --input "$mira_file" --min_length $min_length --min_cover $min_cover --min_reads $min_reads #if str($maf_wanted)=="true": --maf "$out_maf" #end if #if str($fasta_wanted)=="true": --fasta "$out_fasta" #end if #if str($bam_wanted)=="true": --bam "$out_bam" #end if ##Don't yet have a Galaxy datatype defined for ace: ## #if str($ace_wanted)=="true": ## --ace "$out_ace" ## #end if #if str($cstats_wanted)=="true": --cstats "$out_cstats" #end if

param.name: min_length
param.label: Minimum contig length
param.help: e.g. Set to 1000 to exclude small contigs. Default is to keep all contigs (minimum zero)

param.name: min_cover
param.label: Minimum average contig coverage
param.help: e.g. Set to 10 to exclude low coverage contigs. Default is to keep all contigs (minimum zero)

param.name: min_reads
param.label: Minimum reads per contig
param.help: e.g. Set to 5 to exclude low coverage contigs with only a few reads. Default is to keep all contigs (minimum zero).

param.name: maf_wanted
param.label: Output assembly in MIRA's own format? (useful if filtering)

tool.help:
**What it does**
Runs the ``miraconvert`` utility from MIRA v4.0 to filter and/or convert a MIRA Assembly Format file produced by a *mapping* or *de novo* assembly.
**Example Usage**
You want to remove all the low coverage contigs from a transcriptome assembly to focus on those with higher coverage.
You want to convert your MIRA assembly into SAM/BAM to run a standard SNP finding tool.
You've lost the FASTA consensus from your MIRA assembly and need to regenerate it.
